metadata.title: CVE-2023-3777 on Ubuntu 23.10 (mantic) - high
metadata.description:
A use-after-free vulnerability in the Linux kernel's netfilter: nf_tablescomponent can be exploited to achieve local privilege escalation. Whennf_tables_delrule() is flushing table rules, it is not checked whether thechain is bound and the chain's owner rule can also release the objects incertain circumstances. We recommend upgrading past commit6eaf41e87a223ae6f8e7a28d6e78384ad7e407f8.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2023-3777` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-6.5.0-5-generic - 6.5.0-5.5
linux-image-unsigned-6.5.0-5-generic - 6.5.0-5.5
linux-image-unsigned-6.5.0-5-generic-64k - 6.5.0-5.5
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.5.0-1005-aws - 6.5.0-1005.5
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.5.0-1004-azure - 6.5.0-1004.4
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.5.0-1004-gcp - 6.5.0-1004.4
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.5.0-5-lowlatency - 6.5.0-5.5.1
linux-image-unsigned-6.5.0-5-lowlatency-64k - 6.5.0-5.5.1
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.5.0-1005-oracle - 6.5.0-1005.5
No subscription required

linux-image-6.5.0-1002-raspi - 6.5.0-1002.2
No subscription required

linux-image-6.5.0-1002-starfive - 6.5.0-1002.3
No subscription required
